revised_title: Leonard Francis La Cour: A Self-Made Career in Science
tldr: Leonard Francis La Cour was a self-made man who started his career as a laboratory assistant at the age of 14 and became an expert in revealing chromosomes. Despite not having a formal education, La Cour's talent and hard work led him to have an international reputation and several honors. His unorthodox apprenticeship and dedication to improving techniques in plant cytology made him a mentor to many students and a significant figure in the field of genetics.
